doc:
Lizabeth Scott https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lizabeth_Scott 0 Lizabeth Virginia Scott (born Emma Matzo; September 29, 1922 – January 31, 2015) was an American actress, known for her "smoky voice" and being "the most beautiful face of film noir during the 1940s and 1950s". After understudying the role of Sabina in the original Broadway and Boston stage productions of The Skin of Our Teeth, she emerged in such films as The Strange Love of Martha Ivers (1946), Dead Reckoning (1947), Desert Fury (1947), and Too Late for Tears (1949). Of her 22 films, she was the leading lady in all but one. In addition to stage and radio, she appeared on television from the late 1940s to early 1970s. Lizabeth_Virginia_Scott ( born Emma_Matzo ; September_29_,_1922 – January_31_,_2015 ) was an_American_actress , known for her_"_smoky_voice " and being " the_most_beautiful_face of film noir during the_1940s_and_1950s_" . After understudying the_role of Sabina in the_original_Broadway_and_Boston_stage_productions of The_Skin of Our_Teeth , she emerged in such_films as The_Strange_Love of Martha_Ivers_(_1946_)_,_Dead_Reckoning_(_1947_) , Desert_Fury_(_1947_) , and Too_Late for Tears (_1949_) . Of her_22_films , she was the_leading_lady in all_but_one . In addition to stage_and_radio , she appeared on television from the_late_1940s to early_1970s .
